Description: Sabre with steel blade, broad, scimitar-like tip, and wood and brass hilt.
Curator's comments: Eth.Doc. Almost certainly made in Italy. Reputed to have been presented to the governor of Asmara by Mussolini.
Acquisition notes: Af1992,12.1 to 50 were given by Paul and Mary Massey. It is recorded in the donation book as "a small ethnographical collection mainly from Ghana and Egypt, including a number of Asante goldweights acquired by Miss Melanie McCarthy while working at Kumasi hospital between 1919 and 1931."
